title: YKK’s New DynaPel™ Water-Repellant Zipper Wins Best Product In ISPO Textrends Competition - Textile World Magazine
summary: YKK's DynaPel™ water-repellent zipper won Best Product in accessories category for its use of EMPEL® technology to achieve water repellency without a standard PU film, facilitating garment recycling by eliminating barriers.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as it introduces a sustainable alternative to traditional water-repellent zippers, addressing environmental impacts in textile recycling processes.

green_product: TRUE. This is a green product as the DynaPel zipper is designed to significantly reduce its environmental impact throughout its life cycle by using sustainable materials and promoting recycling.
green_process: TRUE. This is a green process as the use of EMPEL® technology in the manufacturing of the zipper minimizes environmental impacts by eliminating the challenges posed by traditional PU film in garment recycling.

title: “Wool-based products improve crop production” - hortidaily.com
summary: Veratin introduced biodegradable pot and fertilizer supplement products, including Verigrow Pot made from a biodegradable material and Verigrow Supplement with balanced nutrients. The Verigrow range utilizes green chemistry, extracting amino acids from upcycled waste wool, offering organic and sustainable fertilization solutions.
green_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of biodegradable pot and fertilizer supplement products that utilize green chemistry and upcycled materials aligns with green innovation by promoting sustainability and reducing environmental impact in the agricultural sector.
business_innovation: TRUE. Veratin's launch of new biodegradable pot and fertilizer supplement products constitutes business innovation as it introduces unique products that differ significantly from its previous offerings, expanding its market presence and product range.
green_product: TRUE. The Verigrow Pot and Verigrow Supplement qualify as green products due to their design and manufacturing processes that prioritize environmental sustainability, such as the use of biodegradable materials and sustainable production methods.
green_process: TRUE. The green chemistry process used by Veratin to extract amino acids from upcycled waste wool for their Verigrow range demonstrates a green process by minimizing environmental impact and promoting sustainability through waste reduction and resource conservation.
